title.value: О биологической и хозяйственной эффективности инсектицида Землин Г. против двукрылых насекомых на овощных культурах открытого грунта
On biological and economic efficiency of the insecticide Zemlin G against dipterous insects in vegetable open ground crops

journal.title: Vegetable Growing : collection of scientific papers

person.name: Prishchepa, I.A., National Academy of Sciences. Scientific and Practical Center for Arable Farming (Belarus). Institute of Plant Protection

abstract.value: In the conditions of the Republic of Belarus there were presented results on evaluation the insecticide Zemlin, G (50 g/kg diazinon) efficiency against spring cabbage (Delia brassicae Bouche.) and union (Delia Antigua Meig.) flies - the most noxious species for early white cabbage (Brassica oleracea convar. capitata var. alba L.) and bulb onion (Allium сера) from seeds growing. It is determined that at preparation application in soil from calculation 30 g/m2 before cabbage seedlings and seed onion planting the plant damage by fly larvae has decreased for 90%, what has provided with the optimum plant density up to harvest and directly connected with getting the additional vegetable production output per area unit. The yield increase in relation to control has made: early cabbage 27 cwt/ha, bulb onion from seeds -34 cwt/ha.
